verdict: Strong conversion efficiency ($45 CPA) for B2B; well-targeted campaign needs structural expansion for growth

checks.name: Conversion actions defined
checks.finding: 27 conversions tracked — healthy volume for B2B with $1,208 spend

checks.name: Micro vs macro separation
checks.finding: 18.2% conversion rate seems high for B2B — verify that only qualified leads (calls + forms) are Primary, not page views or downloads

checks.name: Conversion value assignment
checks.finding: No conversion values — B2B engineering contracts vary widely. Even estimated values would help prioritize leads

checks.name: Search term audit recency
checks.finding: High-intent keyword campaign — search terms likely well-targeted given 18.2% CVR

checks.name: Negative keyword lists exist
checks.finding: Not verified — engineering terms can attract academic/research traffic

checks.name: Wasted spend assessment
checks.finding: $45 CPA for B2B engineering leads is excellent. 18.2% CVR indicates minimal waste

checks.name: Campaign naming convention
checks.finding: CTM prefix with intent level — clear naming

checks.name: Campaign count per objective
checks.finding: Single campaign — appropriate for budget but limits growth

checks.name: Brand vs Non-Brand separation
checks.finding: No brand campaign. If competitors bid on brand terms, they'd steal traffic

checks.name: PMax present for eligible accounts
checks.finding: No PMax — could help with B2B Display/YouTube visibility but data volume (27 conv) is borderline

checks.name: Search CTR performance
checks.finding: 4.93% CTR is good for B2B engineering queries

checks.name: Keyword targeting
checks.finding: 'High intent keywords' focus is paying off with 18.2% conversion rate — strong keyword selection

checks.name: Search volume opportunity
checks.finding: 3,004 impressions — may be near market saturation for niche B2B or could expand into adjacent terms

checks.name: CTR vs industry benchmark
checks.finding: 4.93% CTR vs ~2.5% B2B benchmark — nearly double the average

checks.name: Ad freshness
checks.finding: Ad creative testing not verified — recommend A/B testing ad copy

checks.name: Smart bidding strategy active
checks.finding: Bidding strategy not verified — with 27 conv/month, Max Conversions would be appropriate

checks.name: Geographic targeting accuracy
checks.finding: B2B service area targeting not verified

checks.name: Audience segments applied
checks.finding: No remarketing or in-market B2B audiences applied — missing re-engagement opportunity for long B2B sales cycle

quickWins.action: Verify conversion tracking — 18.2% CVR is high for B2B; confirm only qualified leads are counted as Primary
Add estimated conversion values based on average contract sizes to enable value-based bidding
Review search terms — add negatives for academic, research, jobs, salary queries
Launch brand Search campaign for brand protection
Add remarketing audiences for site visitors — B2B has long consideration cycles

items: Audit conversion tracking — verify 18.2% CVR is real (not inflated by page views or micro conversions)
Add conversion values for different service types/contract sizes
Review and expand negative keywords for academic/non-commercial intent
Add remarketing audiences for long B2B consideration cycle
Expand keyword coverage into adjacent high-intent engineering service terms
Test phrase match and broad match with Max Conversions bidding
Improve ad extensions with specific engineering capabilities, certifications, case studies
Increase budget to capture more of the 3,004 impression opportunity
Test PMax with B2B-focused creative for broader visibility
Build Customer Match lists from CRM data for similar audience targeting
Implement offline conversion import to feed actual deal values back to Google Ads
